review_title: Make a positive difference to someone's life
pros: The opportunity to enhance and improve a person's life both in the short term and long term. To work as a team with people from all walks of life. To support and be supported by your team members. To support very interesting people. To learn about autism and how to support people with autism. To learn about yourself, because you will be challenged both mentally and physically.
cons: Unsociable hours due to the fact that we support people for 24 hours per day
Long hours and expected to work all hours

review_title: I would never work for this company if I knew what I do now.
pros: If you work with a good team then you're golden, other than that however you're at the whim of your manager who could be genuinely terrible.
cons: Senior management are useless in the extreme. Nepotism was ride, but now the entire family have left.

review_title: Enjoyable job, some issues with company and structure
pros: Lots of different units throughout Cornwall, decent opportunities for training, always opportunities for overtime/more hours, high degree of freedom/autonomy within the job once competent, work can be highly rewarding and fun.
cons: Appropriate staffing often a problem, opportunities for advancement unappealing, little connection between head office and the units themselves.

pros: I've worked for Spectrum for 3 years and I've been given the chance to work from the bottom all the way to deputy manager as well as being put through my NVQs!
cons: My cons will be the same as everyone in the care sector, staffing issues.

job_title: Care Support Worker in Saint Austell, England
cons: low wages bear minimum, you need to do a lot for the wage payed

pros: A very fair company to work for with an excellent training given.Friendly houses to work in with loads of learning and getting experienced dealing with chellenging behaviour.
Lovely service users, lovely staff, amazing manager, fabulous company, caring, all round amazing
cons: People are not aware of the amazing work they do

pros: Staff team and SU's are interesting
